The claim was based on an article publis: which reported that Neil Gorsuch founded and led a "Fascism Forever" club at Georgetown Preparatory School in the 1980s.
The Daily Mail article provided no quote: classmates, teachers, or school representatives verifying the existence of the club. The writer did not appear to have made any effort to contact these parties or confirm the yearbook references.
Inquiries were made to Georgetown Prepar: and the director of communications confirmed that no such club ever existed at the school.
America magazine also made inquiries and: Fascism Forever" club in the Georgetown yearbook were simply a joke among students engaging in political debates.
